isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 MODEL - LIGHT SYSTEMS - TROUBLESHOOTING - Panel

entry.para: Move headlight switch to park light position, and at 15A fuse F8-C and circuit 68B, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 68E or 68B from relay (464-R9), then repair.
Disconnect panel light switch connector (416), and with headlight switch in park light position, measure voltage from circuit 62 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in 15A fuse F8-C, cir. 68C or 62, then repair.
With headlight switch still set, at connector (416), measure voltage from circuit 62 to 11-GS.
Locate open or poor connection in cir. 11-GS or 11-GLC to L3 panel light gnd. adapter (505), then repair.
With headlight switch still set, at connector (416), measure voltage from circuit 62 to 62-GW.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 62-GW, then repair.
At connector (416), measure resistance from circuit 62A to 62W.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 62A or 62W, then repair.

Reconnect panel light switch (416), move headlight switch to park light position. Verify that the output of the dimmer switch varies in steps between 0 and approximately 11 ± 1.5 volts by measuring voltage from cir. 62A to ground. Also visually check the switch's panel light.
With headlight switch in park light position, slide dimmer switch to bright position, and measure voltage to ground at panel light adapter (586).
Locate cause of low or no voltage in cir. 62S or 62M, then repair.
Does heater control panel light function properly?
Remove heater panel light bulb, move headlight switch to park light position, and slide dimmer switch to bright position. At bulb socket (84) and cir. 62P, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 62AD or 62P, then repair.
With switches still set, at bulb socket (84), measure voltage from circuit 62P to 62-GP.
Locate open or poor connection in cir. 62-GP or 11-G to right cab ground stud (404), then repair.
Heater control panel light circuits check good. Replace burned out bulb.
Does cigar lighter panel light function properly?
Remove cigar lighter panel light bulb, move headlight switch to park light position, and slide dimmer sw. to bright position. At bulb socket and black wire, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 62AE, 62BW, 62T, or black wire, then repair.
With switches still set, at bulb socket, measure voltage from black wire to socket (ground).
Locate open or poor connection in socket ground, then repair.
Cigar lighter panel light circuits check good. Replace burned out bulb.
Do right gauge cluster panel lights function properly?
Disconnect right gauge cluster connector (72), move headlight switch to park light position, and slide dimmer switch to bright position. At conn. (72) and circuit 62B, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 62B, then repair.
With switches still set, at connector (72), measure voltage from circuit 62B to 11-GW.
Locate open or poor connection in cir. 11-GW or 11-GD to left cab ground stud (429), then repair.
Circuits to right gauge cluster panel lights check good. Replace defective lamps or socket assembly.
Do left gauge cluster panel lights function properly?
Disconnect left gauge cluster conn. (73), move headlight switch to park light position, and slide dimmer switch to bright position. At conn. (73) and cir. 62C, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in cir. 62C, then repair.
With switches still set, at connector (73), measure voltage from circuit 62C to 11-GV.
Locate open or poor connection in cir. 11-GV or 11-GF to left cab ground stud (429), then repair.
Circuits to left gauge cluster panel lights check good. Replace defective lamps or socket assembly.
Does tachometer panel light (63) function properly?
Remove tachometer panel light bulb, move headlight switch to park light position, and slide dimmer sw. to bright position. At bulb socket (63) and cir. 62E, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 62E, then repair.
With switches still set, at bulb socket (63), measure voltage from cir. 62E to 62-GE.
Locate open or poor connection in cir. 62-GE or 11-GAC to left cab ground stud (429), then repair.
Circuits to tachometer panel light (63) check good. Replace burned out bulb.
Does tachometer panel light (64) function properly?
Remove tachometer panel light bulb, move headlight switch to park light position, and slide dimmer sw. to bright position. At bulb socket (64) and cir. 62D, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 62D, then repair.
With switches still set, at bulb socket (64), measure voltage from cir. 62D to 62-GD.
Locate open or poor connection in cir. 62-GD, then repair.
Circuits to tachometer panel light (64) check good. Replace burned out bulb.
Does speedometer panel light (67) function properly?
Remove speedometer panel light bulb, move headlight switch to park light position, and slide dimmer sw. to bright position. At bulb socket (67) and cir. 62G, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in cir. 62G, then repair.
With switches still set, at bulb socket (67), measure voltage from cir. 62G to 62-GG.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 62-GG, then repair.
Circuits to speedometer panel light (67) check good. Replace burned out bulb.
Does speedometer panel light (68) function properly?
Remove speedometer panel light bulb, move headlight sw. to park light position, and slide dimmer sw. to bright position. At bulb socket (68) and cir. 62F, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in cir. 62F, then repair.
With switches still set, at bulb socket (68), measure voltage from cir. 62F to 62-GF.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 62-GF, then repair.
Circuits to speedometer panel light (68) check good. Replace burned out bulb.
Does push button start panel light function properly?
Remove push button start panel light bulb, move headlight sw. to park light position, and slide dimmer sw. to bright position. At bulb socket (541) and circuit 62AX, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 62AX, then repair.
With switches still set, at bulb socket, measure voltage from cir. 62AX to 62-GAX.
Locate open or poor connection in cir. 62-GAX to L3 panel light ground adapter (505), then repair.
Push button start panel light circuits check good. Replace burned out bulb.
Does fresh air control panel light function properly?
Remove fresh air control panel light bulb, move headlight switch to park light position, and slide dimmer sw. to bright position. At bulb socket (494) and cir. 62AU, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 62P, conn. (84), or circuit 62AU, then repair.
With switches still set, at bulb socket (494), measure voltage from circuit 62AU to 62-GAU.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 62-GAU, conn. (84), cir. 62-GP or 11-G to right cab gnd. stud (404), then repair.
Fresh air control panel light circuits check good. Replace burned out bulb.
Does key switch panel light function properly?
Remove key sw. light bulb, move headlight sw. to park light position, and slide dimmer sw. to bright position. At bulb socket (495) and cir. 62AT, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 62AT, then repair.
With switches still set, at bulb socket (495), measure voltage from cir. 62AT to 62-GAT.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 62-GAT or 11-GLB to panel gnd. adapter (587), then repair.
Key switch panel light circuits check good. Replace burned out bulb.
Panel light circuits check good. Move headlight switch to off position.
